intro: Discaria toumatou, commonly known as the mountain devil, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Rhamnaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and spiny, glandular leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its small, oval-shaped fruits are encased in a fleshy, red covering that attracts birds for seed dispersal. Discaria toumatou plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, supporting local wildlife and contributing to the biodiversity of New Zealand's flora.
